Istana Pastikan Anggota Dewan Pengawas KPK Bukan Mantan Terpidana
07 Nov 2019, 09:57 by Friski Riana, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Juru bicara Istana Kepresidenan, Fadjroel Rachman, memastikan Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi tidak akan memilih Dewan Pengawas KPK yang pernah menjalani pidana.
"Dalam kriteria UU Nomor 19 Tahun 2019 dikatakan terkait dengan hukum dikatakan bahwa untuk dapat diangkat sebagai anggota Dewan Pengawas dalam Pasal 37 itu tidak pernah dipidana penjara berdasarkan putusan pengadilan yang telah memperoleh kekuatan hukum tetap," kata Fadjroel di Kompleks Istana Kepresidenan Jakarta, Kamis, 7 November 2019.
Fadjroel mengatakan, Jokowi sudah berjanji akan memilih Dewan Pengawas KPK yang sesuai dengan kriteria pada UU KPK. Selain merujuk pada undang-undang, kata Fadjroel, Jokowi juga mempertimbangkan kriteria sesuai politik hukum pemerintah. "Politik hukum pemerintah adalah penegakkan hukum setegak-tegaknya, yaitu menghormati UU Nomor 19 Tahun 2019 yang telah direvisi."
Menurut Fadjroel, politik hukum pemerintah adalah antikorupsi. Sehingga, kriteria Dewan Pengawas tidak pernah menjalani tindak pidana kejahatan dengan ancaman penjara paling singkat 5 tahun, misalnya, pidana korupsi.
Seperti diketahui, pengguna media sosial mengusulkan sejumlah nama untuk masuk menjadi Dewan Pengawas KPK, misalnya mantan Gubernur DKI Jakarta Basuki Tjahaja Purnama alias Ahok dan mantan Ketua KPK Antasari Azhar. Kedua nama itu diketahui pernah dipidana penjara.
Saat ini, nama-nama anggota Dewan Pengawas KPK masih dalam pembahasan di Sekretariat Negara. Jokowi membentuk tim seleksi yang dipimpin Menteri Sekretaris Negara Pratikno. Setneg akan mendapatkan nama-nama calon Dewan Pengawas berdasarkan pengajuan dan masukan masyarakat. Nantinya, pengangkatan pimpinan KPK periode 2019-2023 ini bersamaan dengan pengangkatan Dewan Pengawas.

Palace Ensures Members of KPK's Supervisory Board Are Not Former Convicted Persons
Nov. 7, 2019, 09:57 by Friski Riana, Amirullah
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Presidential Palace spokesperson, Fadjroel Rachman, ensures that President Joko Widodo or Jokowi will not elect a KPK Supervisory Board that has served a crime.
"In the criteria of Law Number 19 Year 2019 it is said that related to the law it is said that to be appointed as a member of the Supervisory Board in Article 37 it has never been imprisoned based on a court decision that has obtained permanent legal force," Fadjroel said at the Presidential Palace Complex in Jakarta, Thursday, November 7, 2019.
Fadjroel said, Jokowi had promised to elect the KPK Supervisory Board in accordance with the criteria in the KPK Law. In addition to referring to the law, said Fadjroel, Jokowi also considered criteria in accordance with the legal politics of the government. "The politics of government law is the upright enforcement of the law, which is to respect Law No. 19 of 2019 which has been revised."
According to Fadjroel, government legal politics is anti-corruption. Thus, the criteria of the Supervisory Board have never served a crime with the threat of imprisonment for at least 5 years, for example, criminal corruption.
As is known, social media users propose a number of names to enter the KPK Supervisory Board, for example former Jakarta Governor Basuki Tjahaja Purnama alias Ahok and former KPK Chairman Antasari Azhar. Both names are known to have been sentenced to prison.
At present, the names of the KPK Supervisory Board members are still under discussion at the State Secretariat. Jokowi formed a selection team led by Minister of State Secretary Pratikno. The State Secretariat will get the names of the candidates for the Supervisory Board based on the submission and input from the public. Later, the appointment of the leadership of the KPK 2019-2023 period coincides with the appointment of the Supervisory Board.
